body: I'd rather move this after all `setAttribute`. This shouldn't cause any issues, right?

Thanks for fixing this.

ACK 099e4b9ad3d9967051d5c3d45c6315d1b30fea05


Before (see the broken icons in the lower right):
![Screenshot from 2019-06-20 14-47-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6399679/59873671-834a1e80-936a-11e9-8727-6b6d1b5019ce.png)

After:
![Screenshot from 2019-06-20 14-46-30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6399679/59873688-8b09c300-936a-11e9-9304-52cb17f748fb.png)

Nice!
Finally someone figured this out and made it happen.

utACK 099e4b9ad3d9967051d5c3d45c6315d1b30fea05
Will test on Win/linux soon.

It's def. a backport.

@promag 
> can you run `QT_FATAL_WARNINGS=1 src/qt/bitcoin-qt` without this change?
```
hebasto@bionic-qt:~/bitcoin$ QT_FATAL_WARNINGS=1 src/qt/bitcoin-qt 
Attribute Qt::AA_EnableHighDpiScaling must be set before QCoreApplication is created.
Aborted (core dumped)
```

@hebasto thank you. I think reviewers should set `QT_FATAL_WARNINGS=1` on their systems, can prevent incomplete changes like #16118.
Tested on Win10... much much better HiDPI experience. Master: **This PR:**
Though it seems not to resolve the HiDPI issues on Ubuntu Gnome:
Hmm, that's odd. I was testing on fedora 30 gnome and the issue was fixed there.
